title: RBC, Macquarie launch $280m Karoon raising
text:
Macquarie and RBC have underwritten the deal. The brokers were calling for domestic fund manager bids by 3pm on Wednesday.

The company's shares went into a trading halt on Wednesday morning ahead of the raising. The stock is due to resume trading on Friday.

The raising is nearly three months in the making. The company first fronted funds in July when it signed a $US665 million ($948 million) deal to acquire the Brazilian oil field Bauna, and it has been in front of investors with updates on the deal since.

It also comes 10 days after Karoon submitted a comprehensive investor presentation to the ASX about the proposed Bauna acquisition, which included confirmation Karoon intended to raise equity from new and existing investors to cover the purchase.

However on closer inspection, and as revealed by Street Talk, the presentation released to the ASX was initially titled “Project Wilson – Karoon Equity Raise overview”, according to the document’s metadata, and was authored by a junior banker in Macquarie Capital’s Perth office.

Karoon then filed an updated presentation on its own website, titled “Karoon Investor Review October 2019” and authored by the company’s corporate finance manager Al Gordon, to cover up what appeared to be a monumental own goal.
description: Karoon Energy has finally launched its equity raising to fund the company's proposed Brazilian acquisition.
